comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.10 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/8.0.552.224 Safari/534.10
Build Identifier: 

I've installed Testopia 2.4 on Bugzilla 3.6.3 and am trying to import xml test
cases.  The import is failing because of renamed Testopia modules.  When I fix
the module names, it then fails taint checks.

An example of a misnamed module is on line 104 of tr_importer.cgi
  my $importer = new Testopia::Importer;
I believe it should be this instead:
  my $importer = new Bugzilla::Extension::Testopia::Importer;

There were 3 additional instances of this also in
extensions/Testopia/lib/Importer.pm

After fixing those errors, I still can't import xml test data because the
call fails taint checks.  Here is the apache log from the error:

[Mon Jan 10 13:23:40 2011] [error] [client 10.54.14.22] [Mon Jan 10 13:23:40 2011] tr_importer.cgi: Insecure dependency in eval while running with -T switch at /usr/lib/perl5/5.8.5/PerlIO.pm line 22., referer: https://devbugs.[example].com/tr_show_product.cgi
[Mon Jan 10 13:23:40 2011] [error] [client 10.54.14.22] [Mon Jan 10 13:23:40 2011] tr_importer.cgi: BEGIN failed--compilation aborted., referer: https://devbugs.[example].com/tr_show_product.cgi

As best I can tell, the failure is because of the call on line 105 of tr_importer.cgi:
  my $case_ids = $importer->parse($data,$cgi->param('product_id'),$cgi->param('plan_id'));

I tried cleaning product_id and plan_id but was still encountering problems; I
haven't done much troubleshooting of taint issues so I'm not sure the best way
to go about it.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a test plan, go to File, Import, Test Plans from XML
2. Select an xml test case file
3. Hit submit
Actual Results:  
Import fails.

Expected Results:  
Import Succeeds
